Package com.CS4398.spc51.gods.alter

Class AlterManager

java.lang.Object
com.CS4398.spc51.gods.alter.AlterManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.event.Listener
public class AlterManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
The Class AlterManager.
Author:
Shaun Coyne (spc51) The Class AlterManager. Listens for actions on blocks to see if the Alters have been created or destroyed. If this method is inefficent, we could periodically check the alters to see if they are intact.

  • Constructor Details

    • AlterManager

      public AlterManager()
      Instantiates a new alter manager. Loads the save file to populate the alterList.

  • Method Details

    • onBlockBreak

      public void onBlockBreak​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockBreakEvent event)
      On block break. This is the general catch-all for detecting the destruction of altars. Should check to see who broke it. Was it sabotage? Or is a believer rebelling.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockBurn

      public void onBlockBurn​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockBurnEvent event)
      On block burn. Can natural, can be caused by players. The block is destroyed when it is burned, so the alter is broken.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockDamage

      public void onBlockDamage​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockDamageEvent event)
      On block damage. This is called as the block is being broken
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • onBlockExplode

      public void onBlockExplode​(org.bukkit.event.block.BlockExplodeEvent event)
      On block explode. Could be natural, could be cause by a player.
      Parameters:
      event - the event

    • checkForAlterCreation

      public static void checkForAlterCreation​(org.bukkit.block.Block block, Believer believer)
      Check for alter creation by looking at nearby blocks against templates. For efficency, we should check if the player is in alter building mode.
      Parameters:
      block - the block
      believer - the believer
